means: 女学者，装做有学问的女人

sentence.Network_en: As a bel esprit he despised pedantry whether in a man or in a bluestocking.
sentence.Network_cn: 作为一个才子,他看不起卖弄学问的作风,不管这种作风是由男人还是女才子所表现出来的.

sentence.Network_en: She's no more than a bluestocking.
sentence.Network_cn: 她也只不过是个书呆子.

“蓝袜子(bluestocking)”曾用以指一个学者或知识渊博的女人。古埃及法老穿蓝色以辟邪。

《青》一名来自英国十八世纪的“蓝袜子派”（bluestockings）女文人，蓝袜子亦在后来成为了日本新女性象征。虽然今天的“老圣保罗” …

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: originally used to describe a man wearing blue worsted (instead of formal black silk) stockings; extended to mean 'in informal dress'. Later the term denoted a person who attended the literary assemblies held (c. 1750) by three London society ladies, where some of the men favoured less formal dress. The women who attended became known as blue-stocking ladies or blue-stockingers

entry.def: A bluestocking is an intellectual woman.

means.word_mean: 1. a woman having literary or intellectual interests

auth_sentence.content: Bel is a moon-luminous, chain-smoking bluestocking with an arse specifically built by God to be put in a pencil skirt.

auth_sentence.content: My mother took me out of Miss Madeira's school, because she was afraid I would learn too much and become a bluestocking.
